intro: Arrabidaea whitei, commonly known as the white arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
